review_blob: Bottle.  Pours with very pale yellow, almost no head and no aroma (but then, I do have a bit of a cold).  Didnt have high expectations and was not disappointed, meaning this beer is just plain bad.  Flavor was flat, a little sweet and no hint of any hops at all.  I have another bottle, might try that one to be sure I didnt get a skunky one, but then I doubt that.  Drain pour...

Had this on tap at St. Stephens Green in downtown Mountain View, CA tonight - and for $2 no less!  Wow, cherry aroma hits you right away - very strong and sweet smelling.  Appearance was golden to dark, weak head.  Flavor was not as strong as the aroma, and was okay, not great.  I wont have this again because I just dont care for friut in my beer personally.

Bottle and tap - this is an excellent example of Weisbier.  Had this in Bonn recently too and its much better there than here in the US.  The appearance is cloudy, but bright.  Taste is slightly citrus and smooth.  Easy to drink and very refreshing.

Bottle from Whole Foods on Old Milton.  Okay, I am new at this rating of beer, but this Ale tastes & looks good.  Letting it warm up a bit is the best thing I could do for it.  Tastes a bit nutty (?), weak head, but good aroma.  I like this one and will purchase again.

Very dark, as it should be.  Little to no head.  Chocolate aroma is instantly detected.  Picked this beer up in Cost Plus in Buford, room temp.  Might have tasted better if they had kept it cold.  The taste improved as I drunk it.  Very good cream stout.  Ill have this again.

Finally, the great beers are available in Georgia.  This beer is what I always figured a Doppelbock would taste like.  The flavor blew me away.  The color is as expected, but wow - what an awesome kick.  Excellent.  Available at Harrys Farmers Market in Alpharetta.
